Identification.LongTitle: Commercial Loan (Insurance Companies, Societies, Insurance Holding Companies and Foreign Companies) Regulations

Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Finance, pursuant to section 1021a of the Insurance Companies Actb, hereby makes the annexed Commercial Loan (Insurance Companies, Societies and Insurance Holding Companies) Regulations.

Section.Text: In these Regulations, Act means the Insurance Companies Act.
For the purposes of the definition commercial loan in subsection 490(1) of the Act, the prescribed international agencies are

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the International Finance Corporation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Inter-American Development Bank;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Asian Development Bank;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the African Development Bank;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the European Investment Bank;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the Caribbean Development Bank;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the Nordic Investment Bank;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the Council of Europe Development Bank.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of the definition commercial loan in subsection 490(1) of the Act, widely distributed means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of debt obligations the distribution of which is exempt from the requirement to file a prospectus under the laws of Canada, a province or a jurisdiction outside Canada, that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: at least 90% of the maximum authorized principal of the debt obligations is held by one or more persons other than the company and its subsidiaries, and

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the debt obligations were issued to at least 25 persons other than the company and its subsidiaries within six months after the day on which the first of the debt obligations was issued, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: if the debt obligations are issued on a continuous basis, there are on average at least 25 holders other than the company and its subsidiaries, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: at the time of their initial distribution, the debt obligations met at least three of the following criteria:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: their initial term was less than one year,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: they were rated by a rating agency,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: they were distributed through a person authorized to trade in securities, and

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: they were distributed in accordance with an offering circular or memorandum, or a similar document relating to the distribution of securities; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of any other securities, that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: they are listed and posted for trading on a recognized stock exchange, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a prospectus relating to the issuance of the securities was filed under the laws of Canada, a province or a jurisdiction outside Canada.

Subsection.Text: In subparagraph (1)(a)(i) maximum authorized principal means, in relation to any debt obligation, the maximum amount of debt that may be issued under the terms of the debt obligation or any agreement relating to it.

Section.MarginalNote: Prescribed subsidiaries of a life company

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of sections 503 and 504 of the Act, all subsidiaries of a life company are prescribed subsidiaries of the company.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Prescribed subsidiaries of a property and casualty company
Subsection.Text: For the purpose of section 505 of the Act, a prescribed subsidiary of a property and casualty company is a subsidiary of the company that is not

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a financial institution;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a bank holding company or an insurance holding company;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a subsidiary of a financial institution, other than where the subsidiary is a subsidiary of a financial institution only because it is a subsidiary of the company; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a subsidiary of a bank holding company or an insurance holding company.

Section.Text: For the purpose of section 505 of the Act, the prescribed percentage is 5%.

Section.MarginalNote: Definition of total assets of a life company

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of section 503 of the Act, total assets, in respect of a life company, at a particular time, means the total of the assets that would be reported on the balance sheet of the company prepared as at that time in accordance with the accounting principles and specifications of the Superintendent referred to in subsection 331(4) of the Act.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Definition of total assets of a property and casualty company and a marine company
Subsection.Text: For the purpose of section 505 of the Act, total assets, in respect of a property and casualty company or a marine company, at a particular time, means the amount determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the total of the assets that would be reported on the balance sheet of the company prepared as at that time in accordance with the accounting principles and specifications of the Superintendent referred to in subsection 331(4) of the Act; and
is the total of the assets included in the value of A that are assets of a subsidiary of the company that is

FormulaParagraph.Label: (b)
FormulaParagraph.Text: a bank holding company or an insurance holding company;

FormulaParagraph.Label: (c)
FormulaParagraph.Text: a subsidiary of a financial institution, other than where the subsidiary is a subsidiary of a financial institution only because it is a subsidiary of the company; or

FormulaParagraph.Label: (d)
FormulaParagraph.Text: a subsidiary of a bank holding company or an insurance holding company.

Section.Text: For the purpose of section 562 of the Act, a prescribed subsidiary of a society is a subsidiary of the society that is not

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a financial institution; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a subsidiary of a financial institution, other than where the subsidiary is a subsidiary of a financial institution only because it is a subsidiary of the society.

Section.Text: For the purpose of section 562 of the Act, the prescribed percentage is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the society has twenty-five million dollars or less of capital, 5%; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the society has more than twenty-five million dollars of capital, 100%.

Section.MarginalNote: Definition of total assets of a society
Section.Text: For the purpose of section 562 of the Act, total assets, in respect of a society, at a particular time, means the amount determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the total of the assets that would be reported on the balance sheet of the society prepared as at that time in accordance with the accounting principles and specifications of the Superintendent referred to in subsection 331(4) of the Act; and

is the total of the assets included in the value of A that are assets of a subsidiary of the society that is a financial institution or that are assets of a subsidiary of a financial institution other than where the subsidiary is a subsidiary of a financial institution only because it is a subsidiary of the society.

Section.MarginalNote: Prescribed subsidiaries of an insurance holding company
Section.Text: For the purpose of sections 979 and 980 of the Act, all subsidiaries of an insurance holding company are prescribed subsidiaries of the insurance holding company.

Section.MarginalNote: Definition of total assets of an insurance holding company
Section.Text: For the purpose of section 979 of the Act, total assets, in respect of an insurance holding company, at a particular time, means the total of the assets that would be reported on the balance sheet of the insurance holding company prepared as at that time in accordance with the accounting principles and specifications of the Superintendent referred to in subsection 887(4) of the Act.
For the purposes of subsections 616(1) and (2) of the Act,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a foreign life company the value of whose assets in Canada for the classes of insurance referred to in those subsections exceeds the aggregate of its liabilities in Canada and the margin of assets in Canada over liabilities in Canada referred to in subsection 608(1) of the Act in respect of those classes by 25 million dollars or less, the prescribed percentage of the value of those assets is five per cent; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a foreign life company the value of whose assets in Canada for the classes of insurance referred to in those subsections exceeds the aggregate of its liabilities in Canada and the margin of assets in Canada over liabilities in Canada referred to in subsection 608(1) of the Act in respect of those classes by more than 25 million dollars, the prescribed percentage of the value of those assets is 100 per cent.

Heading.TitleText: Foreign Property and Casualty Companies and Foreign Marine Companies

Section.Text: For the purpose of section 617 of the Act, the prescribed percentage of the value of the assets in Canada of a foreign property and casualty company or a foreign marine company is five per cent.

These Regulations come into force on the day on which sections 494, 503 to 505, 561 to 564, 979 and 980 of the Insurance Companies Act, as enacted by sections 426, 437, 439, and 465 of the Financial Consumer Agency of Canada Act, chapter 9 of the Statutes of Canada, 2001, come into force.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Regulations in force October 24, 2001, see SI/2001-102.]
